lead_paragraph: WEBER--Joy S. Passed away on March 13, 2016 at her Santa Fe, NM home, surrounded by family and friends. Joy was born in Trenton, NJ on June 24, 1927 and grew up in Great Neck, Long Island. She lived in Great Neck and Jackson Heights, Queens before settling in Santa Fe, NM 30 years ago. Joy was a staunch advocate for her father, the artist Max Weber and spent her life working to promote and preserve his legacy. His work is represented by the Gerald Peters Gallery in both New York City and Santa Fe. Joy's vast knowledge of 20th Century art was put to good use as a longtime volunteer at the Museum of Fine Arts in Santa Fe and as a docent at the O'Keefe Museum. She was a generous supporter of numerous charities and cared deeply about helping those less fortunate. Joy was passionate about classical music and opera in particular as well as nature, politics and her beloved Corgis. Joy was a talented artist in her own right and enjoyed painting for a number of years. She is survived by her brother, Maynard Weber, of Virginia, cousins Ilene V. Fishman of Montclair, NJ, Fred Fishman of San Francisco, CA, Solna K. (Kandi) Wasser of Dade City, FL and Elena Lamb, her dear and devoted friend of the last 50 years, of Santa Fe. In lieu of flowers, the family requests any donations to be made to the Alzheimer's Foundation of America. 1/3
